q: Owens. Ann Marie Buerkle , in an interview, said she welcomes the idea of sitting with her Central New York neighbors from both parties. She said it would be great to expand the idea. It would be nice for the whole New York delegation to sit together, Ann Marie Buerkle said. The delegation has 21 Democrats and eight Republicans. Senators reach across aisle Both of New York's U.S. senators, Chuck Schumer and Kirsten Gillibrand , have already selected Republican partners to sit with

Simon Cowell `` I wanted to do a show where judges could help competitors on a weekly basis,'' Simon Cowell said, comparing the job to his days as an A&R rep at a record label. It's more interesting to me; it definitely gives me something more to do. When an artist wins, you win. It really does become an incredible competition with judges, in a way more than the artists, because we don't pretend to like each other. Simon Cowell said a decision about who will sit beside him on the panel will be made in the next three or four weeks. He says he's looking for people who could one-up him in battle.

Welcome to the 112th Congress. American people-- this is your week. I am excited about this partnership with Nokia, said Steve Ballmer , Microsoft CEO.`` Ecosystems thrive when fuelled by speed, innovation and scale.The partnership announced today provides incredible scale, vast expertise in hardware and software innovation and a proven ability to execute.''

book details the behind-the-scenes stories of Michael Vick 's surviving dogs and the influence, resilience, dedication and commitment of the animal behavior experts, animal-care groups, lawyers and government officials that united to save them. expressed a hope for the presenter to finally topple Jay Leno 's long-time lead.`` I want to see you beat Jay Leno in the ratings tonight,'' he said. The DJ then joked: Look, I love you, I'm in your corner. I don't want the same thing to happen to you that happened to Regis[ Philbin]. The rivalry between the two late-night hosts stems from NBC's decision to hire Jay Leno to replace Johnny Carson on The Tonight Show in 1992, passing over David Letterman in the process. Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer said the partnership would give the team more innovation, greater global reach and scale. `` We need to, and we will, collaborate closely on development... so we can really align and drive the future revolution of the mobile phone,'' he said.
